main event: A bright light was observed flying at a very high speed over Lake Melissa, Minnesota on August 9, 1965.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 30 seconds, moving from north to south.
The light was several times brighter than any star or planet and left no trail or sound.
The witness estimated the speed to be at least 1,000 miles per hour, which is much faster than a typical aircraft.
The witness had seen many planes and satellites before but this was unlike anything they had seen.
The object simply disappeared from sight.
sighted object: A bright light in the sky
witnesses: the witness and two other people
